Package edu.uoc.uocoban.model

Class Level

java.lang.Object
edu.uoc.uocoban.model.Level
public class Level extends Object
Represents a level in the game.

      Constructor with argument.
      Parameters:
      fileName - Value for the attribute fileName.
      Throws:
      LevelException - If there are any problems while parsing the level configuration file.

    • setFileName

    • getFileName

      public String getFileName()
      Getter of the attribute fileName
      Returns:
      Current value of the attribute fileName

    • parse

      private void parse() throws LevelException
      Parses/Reads level's data from the given file.
      It also checks if the board's requirements are met.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When there is any error while parsing the file or some board's requirement is not satisfied.

    • getFirstNonEmptyLine

      private String getFirstNonEmptyLine(BufferedReader br) throws IOException
      This is a helper method for parse() which returns the first non-empty and non-comment line from the reader.
      Parameters:
      br - BufferedReader object to read from.
      Returns:
      First line that is a parsable line, or null there are no lines to read.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the reader fails to read a line.

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      Getter of the attribute width.
      Returns:
      The current value of the attribute width.

    • setWidth

      private void setWidth(int width) throws LevelException
      Setter of the attribute width.
      Parameters:
      width - New value for the attribute width.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When width is less than MIN_WIDTH.

      private void setHeight(int height) throws LevelException

      Parameters:
      height - New value for the attribute height.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When height is less than MIN_HEIGHT.

    • setRemainingMovements

      private void setRemainingMovements(int remainingMovements) throws LevelException
      Setter of the attribute remainingMovements.
      Parameters:
      remainingMovements - New value for the attribute remainingMovements.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When remainingMovements is less or equal than 0.

    • decRemainingMovements

      public void decRemainingMovements()
      Decreases in 1 the remainingMovements attribute value. If remainingMovements is less or equal than 0, this method does nothing.

    • getMapItemList

      public List<MapItem> getMapItemList()

      Iterator of the attribute mapItemList.

    • getMapItem

      public MapItem getMapItem(int x, int y)
      Returns the map/labyrinth item which is in the position (x,y).
      Parameters:
      x - Value of the position in the X axis.
      y - Value of the position in the Y axis.
      Returns:
      If any, the item which is the position (x,y). Otherwise, null.

    • getMapItem

      public MapItem getMapItem(Position position) throws NullPointerException
      Returns the map/labyrinth item which is in position.
      Parameters:
      position - The position where the item that we want to get is.
      Returns:
      If any, the item which is position. Otherwise, null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - When position is null.

    • addMapItem

      public void addMapItem(MapItem item)
      Adds item to the mapItemList as long as item is not null.
      Parameters:
      item - Item which we want to add.

    • removeMapItem

      public void removeMapItem(MapItem item)
      Removes item from the mapItemList.
      Parameters:
      item - Item which we want to remove.

    • getBoxList

      public List<Box> getBoxList()
      Getter of the attribute boxList.
      Returns:
      The current value of the attribute boxList.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Getter ot the attribute player.
      Returns:
      The current value of the attribute player.

    • hasWon

      public boolean hasWon()
      Checks if the level was finished. This happens when all the objects from type Destination have a valid Box.
      Returns:
      true if none items of type Destination are empty. Otherwise, false.

    • isDeadlocked

      public boolean isDeadlocked()
      Checks if the level is deadlocked (i.e., there is at least one box that is deadlocked)
      Returns:
      true if the level is deadlocked. Otherwise, false.

    • isDeadlocked

      private boolean isDeadlocked(Box box)
      Checks if the box is deadlocked. A box is deadlocked if it is not delivered and any of the following conditions is reached:
      • The box is cornered between non pathable and non movable items
      • The box is next to another box and none of them can be moved if the other does not moves first.
      Parameters:
      box - The box object to which deadlock is evaluated.
      Returns:
      true if deadlock condition for box is achieved; false otherwise.

    • isPathableOrMovable

      private boolean isPathableOrMovable(int x, int y)
      Checks whether the map item in a given position represented by x and y is pathable or movable.
      Parameters:
      x - The x coordinate of the given position
      y - The y coordinate of the given position
      Returns:
      true if the map item for the given position is pathable or movable; otherwise, false
